Package com.library.frontend.controllers

Interface Controller

All Superinterfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AddBookQuantityController, AdministratorBooksController, AdministratorBooksDialogController, AdministratorOperatorsController, BookFormShowController, CreateBookFormController, CreateOperatorController, CreateReaderProfileController, InboxController, LogInController, OperatorBooksController, OperatorBooksDialogController, OperatorReadersController, RegisterNewBookController, ResumeShowController
public interface Controller extends javafx.fxml.Initializable
The Controller interface serves as the base interface for all JavaFX controllers in the library frontend. It extends the Initializable interface, which ensures that implementing classes provide an initialization method for their controllers. This interface acts as a marker interface to identify classes responsible for controlling the behavior and interaction of corresponding JavaFX views.

JavaFX's controllers are responsible for initializing the UI components, handling user input, and managing the communication between the view and the underlying data model. Implementing classes should override the Initializable.initialize(java.net.URL, java.util.ResourceBundle) method to perform any necessary setup when the controller is initialized.
